== Usage ==

The header element represents the header of a [SectionElement section]. The element is typically used to group a set of [H1H2H3H4H5H6Element h1–h6 elements] to mark up a page's [DocumentTitleProperty title] with its subtitle or tagline. However, [HeaderElement header elements] may contain more than just the section's headings and subheadings — for example it would be reasonable for the header to include version history information.

Here are some examples of valid headers:

{{{
<header>
 <h1>The reality dysfunction</h1>
 <h2>Space is not the only void</h2>
</header>
}}}

{{{
<header>
 <h1>Dr. Strangelove</h1>
 <h2>Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb</h2>
</header>
}}}

{{{
<header>
 <p>Welcome to...</p>
 <h1>Voidwars!</h1>
</header>
}}}

{{{
<header>
 <h1>Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) 1.2</h1>
 <h2>W3C Working Draft 27 October 2004</h2>
